class lib.obj_data.Project(name='Untitled')[source]¶

Bases: object

The top level of data structure. It contains general infomation and configuration of the project.

Variables

  • info (dict) – general infomation including name, file location, create time, last saved time.

  • files (List(FileData)) – files imported in this project.

  • ui_cong (dict) – user interface configuration.

get_path()[source]¶

Return absolute path of this project file location in user’s computer.

append_file(file)[source]¶

Append a file to this Project instance.

Parameters

file (FileData) – Given FileData instance.

delete_files(files)[source]¶

Delete specific files from this Project instance.

Parameters

files (List(FileData)) – A list of FileData instance.

clear_files()[source]¶

Clear all the files in this Project instance.

classmethod load_project(location=None)[source]¶

Retrieve project’s data from a computer file on specific location.

Parameters

location (Optional[str]) – The absolute path of a computer file(/.pkl).

dump(location=None)[source]¶

Save project’s data to computer file on specific location.

Parameters

location (Optional[str]) – The absolute path of a folder.

print()[source]¶

Print the infomation of this Project instance.

update_ui_conf()[source]¶
class lib.obj_data.FileData(name=None, source=None, file_path=None, import_time=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The 2nd level of data structure. It contains general infomation of an imported files.

Variables

  • info (Dict) – general infomation including name, source, file path, create time, last modified time.

  • testnames (List(str)) – a list of all testnames.

  • valid_testnames (List(str)) – a list of testnames that is visible and operatable in app, which is customized by user.

  • measurements (Dict) – user interface configuration.

get_import_time()[source]¶

Return imported time of this FileData instance.

append_measurement(m_idx, measurement)[source]¶

Append a measurement to this FileData instance.

Parameters

  • m_idx (int) – Index of the measurement.

  • measurement (Measurement) – Given Measurement instance.

print()[source]¶

Print the infomation of this FileData instance.

class lib.obj_data.Measurement(channel_count=1, id=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The 3rd level of data structure.

Variables

  • id (int) – index of this measurement.

  • channel (List(Channel)) – a list of Channel instances in this Measurement instance.

init_channels(count)[source]¶

Create given numbers of Channel instances for this Measurement instance.

Parameters

count (int) – Total numbers of channels.

print(console=True)[source]¶

Print the infomation.

class lib.obj_data.Channel(measurement_obj=None, id=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

The 4th level of data structure.

Variables

  • measurement_obj (Measurement) – The Measurement instance this Channel instance belongs to.

  • id (int) – Channel’s id.

  • sequence (Dict) – A dictionary of testname and its corresponding CurveData instance.

print(console=True)[source]¶

Print the infomation.

class lib.obj_data.CurveData(xdata, ydata, channel_obj, label='Curve', note='', _type=<CurveType.NoType: 'None'>, units=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

The bottom (5th) level of data structure.

Variables

  • channel_obj (Channel) – The Channel instance this CurveData instance belongs to.

  • xdata (List(float)) – Curve’s data of x-axis.

  • ydata (List(float)) – Curve’s data of y-axis.

  • label (str) – Curve’s label.

  • note (str) – Curve’s note.

  • _type (CurveType) – Curve’s data category.

  • units (List(str)) – Units of xdata and ydata.

  • shifted (float) – Recorded offset value.

  • line (matplotlib.lines.Line2D) – Matplolib Line2D object created by this CurveData instance.

  • line_props (Dict) – style properties of line.

get_legend(legend_wrap)[source]¶

Return the legend wrapped with a given characters long.

Parameters

legend_wrap (int) – A given number .

create_line2D(canvas, ax_id, order, legend_wrap, color=None, linewidth=1.5)[source]¶

Plot a curve on given canvas’s axis with specific order, text-wrap and color.

Parameters

  • canvas (matplotlib.figure) – Given matplot figure.

  • ax_id (int) – Id of axis.

  • order (int) – Figure would plot each curve by this order.

  • color (str) – Curve’s color.

  • linewidth (float) – Curve’s linewidth.

shift(offset)[source]¶

Shift ydata with given offset, which is always compared with the original data. That is, if the given offset is zero, it would be the original curve.

Parameters

offset (float) – Given offset.

align(targetDB, freq)[source]¶

Shift the curve to align given magnitude at given frequency.

Parameters

  • targetDB (float) – The target y-magnitude to align.

  • freq (float) – The target x-magnitude to align.

print(console=True)[source]¶

Print the infomation.
